row.entry: The type of CDR generated by the NCC application. For NCC, its value is set as OCSChargingRecord.
Signifies the event date and time of call or the CDR generation time. It is presented in standard DD/MM/YYYY HH:MM:SS format.
Contains the unique Credit-Control session identifier as send by Diameter client in the Session-ID AVP of a given Credit-Control-Request message.

Contains a standardized string, which allows identifying the context of a given Session established between Diameter client (for example, PGW) and server (for example, OCS). This tag is taken from the Service-Context-Id AVP as presented in Credit-Control-Request message by diameter client.

Signifies the request type and contains the reason for sending the Credit-Control-Request message. It must be present in all Credit-Control-Request messages. RequestType is taken from the CC-Request-Type AVP as present in Credit-Control-Request message, which have values as: INITIAL_REQUEST, UPDATE_REQUEST, TERMINATION_REQUEST, EVENT_REQUEST
Contains the Access Point Name (APN) to which the user is connected to. It is taken from PS-Information/Called-Station-Id AVP.

Contains the value from PS-Information/User-Location-Info in the following:
OCTET 1 of PLMN-Id = OCTET 2 of User-Location-Info AVP.
OCTET 2 of PLMN-Id = OCTET 3 of User-Location-Info AVP
OCTET 3 of PLMN-Id = OCTET 4 of User-Location-Info AVP

The value of which Radio Access Technology is currently serving the subscriber equipment/device as presented in PS-Information/3GPP-RAT-Type AVP.
The data type is ENUMERATED with valid integer values as follows:
1 (WLAN), 2 (UTRAN), 3 (GERAN), 4 (GAN), 5 (HSPA_EVOLUTION), 6 (EUTRAN), 7 (CDMA2000_1X), 8 (HRPD), 9 (UMB), 10 (EHRPD), 11 (VIRTUAL)
Indicates the roaming status of the Subscriber, that is, whether the subscriber is present in HOME or ROAMING network when a session/event has occurred. It has two values: HOME or ROAMING.

Contains the user name determined by the domain (bearer, sub-system, or service as described in middle tier TS). It is taken from CCR-I only and stored in session memory. It is written in all CDRs generated for a given session.
Account ID of any subscription attached with Device, empty if no subscription attached with device.

Specifies the ID of the group to which the device belongs in the hierarchy. It is taken from the GroupID field as defined in group entity. First Group from Device is taken irrespective of whether it is being charged or not. If a new group is introduced during a call, then it is written in the CDR. If the Device is not the part of the Group, then it is not written to the CDR.
Specifies the value of the 3GPP-Charging-ID AVP from PS-Information. This is the Charging Identifier created by P-GW for a given IP-CAN session.

Signifies the Request-Number to identify a request within a given session. As Session-Id AVP is globally unique, the combination of Session-Id and CC-Request-Number AVPs is also globally unique and can be used in matching Credit-Control-Request messages with confirmations. RequestNumber is taken from the CC-Request-Number AVP as present in the Credit-Control-Request message.
This tag gets the value form from the CCRt AVP.

For CCR-T, its value is decided based on the value of Termination-Cause AVP.
For CCR-U, the value is taken from the ServiceConditionChange tag. Mapping of value of ServiceConditionChange is done with the value of Change-Condition AVP under PS-Information.
For initial request, the value is 0.

Time (as reported in Event-Timestamp AVP, else platform time is used) when CCR-I arrived and it is stored in memory and copied in all CDR generated for a given session. Format of date and time is same as generationTimeStamp tag.

Contains the time (as reported in IMS-Information.Time-Stamps.SIP-Request-Timestamp AVP if present or Event-Timestamp if present, else platform time is used) of that CCR which was received by NCC for a session whose CDR was generated and send in previous CCA.
Time taken from the IMS-Information.Time-Stamps.SIP-Request-Timestamp AVP if present or Event-Timestamp if present, else platform time is used.
The time when CCR-I arrived, is stored in memory, and is copied in all CDR generated for a given session. The value of this tag is taken from 3GPP-User-Location-Info AVP under PS-Information.

The time when CCR-I/U/T arrived. In case of CCR-I, this tag takes the same value as of previous tag. The value of this tag is filled with the value of 3GPP-User-Location-Info AVP under PS-Information.

For CCA-I/U/T calls, this tag is generated if actual result code is manually overridden to send success.
Example: For DEVICE_BARRED, if operator want to send SUCCESS(2001) instead of DIAMETER_AUTHORIZATION_REJECTED(5003) then the CDR tags will be as follows:
OriginalResultCode: 5003
resultCode: 2001
This tag takes the value from CCA AVP. The resultCode from MSCC is filled to MSCC level CDR, and the resultCode from session level is filled to root CDR.
This tag takes value from Node-Id AVP under PS-Information.

This tag takes value from the Serving-Node-Type AVP under PS-Information. The data type is ENUMERATED with valid integer values are as follows:
0 (SGSN), 1 (PMIPSGW), 2 (GTPSGW), 3 (EPDG), 4 (HSGW), 5 (MME), 6 (TWAN),
Value of the tag is taken from PDP-Address AVP under PS-Information.
Value of this tag is taken from GGSN-Address AVP under PS-Information.
Value of this tag is taken from SGSN-Address AVP under PS-Information.
Value of the tag is taken from APN-Aggregate-Max-Bitrate-UL AVP under QoS-Information. This takes value from PS-Information.
Value of the tag is taken from APN-Aggregate-Max-Bitrate-DL AVP under QoS-Information. This takes value from PS-Information.

This value gets incremented when any CDR is generated. It is incremented by n if there are n number of MSCCs in one CCR and per MSCC CDR flag is set. It is incremented by 1 if Per request CDR Generation flag set.
When the recordSequenceNumber reaches its maximum value, that is, 4294967295, then for the next record the value is rolled back to 1. This is applicable for both CDRGeneratedPerMSCC and CDRGeneratedPerRequest.

This value is taken from User-Equipment-Info-Type AVP. It is taken either from command level or from PS-Information. The User-Equipment-Info-Type AVP is of type Enumerated (AVP Code 459) and defines the type of user equipment information contained in the User-Equipment-Info-Value AVP.
The data type is ENUMERATED with valid integer values as follows:
0 (IMEISV), 1 (MAC), 2 (EUI64), 3 (MODIFIED_EUI64), 5 (MEID)
Specifies the value of served IMEI as present in User-Equipment-Info-Value AVP. It is either taken from the command level or from PS-Information.

Day value is decided based on the value of recordClosingTime tag.
Possible values are Sunday, Monday, etc.
Specifies the OCS Host on which Device is configured in NCC.

Contains the time difference (in seconds) between CCR-I and CCR-T. Its calculated as SystemCurrentTime (in terminate req) - sessionStartTime. If sessionDuration exceeds 4294967295, then the value is set to 4294967295.
Specifies the unique device ID allocated by the operator to the Subscriber and same is configured in Device entity. It is taken from Device entity.

Specifies the owner of the device. It contains the user ID of the user who owns the Device, as configured in the Device entity.
A Device can have only one owner.
Specifies the lifecycle state associated with the Device. It can have a varied lifecycle states as defined by the operator, for example, Active, Inactive, Deactive.
Specifies the device partition ID on which the device exists in NCC.
Specifies the device site ID on which the device exists in NCC.
This tag contains a list of Subscription ID tags.
This tag contains child tags with details of a subscription ID.

The subscription ID type. The data type is ENUMERATED with valid integer values as follows:
0 (eND-USER-E164), 1 (eND-USER-IMSI), 2 (eND-USER-SIP-URI), 3 (eND-USER-NAI), 4 (eND-USER-PRIVATE), 100 (eND-EXTERNAL-ID)
Specifies the value of MSISDN/E164/IMSI of subscriber who has triggered the Session/Event call.
This tag contains child tags with for lifecycle states.

Lifecycle state of Account whose ID is mentioned in the accountID tag. It can have lifecycle states as defined by the operator.
Possible values are Active, Inactive, and Deactive.

Lifecycle state of Device whose ID is mentioned in the deviceId tag. It can have lifecycle states as defined by the operator.
Possible values are Active, Inactive, and Deactive.

Lifecycle state of group whose ID is mentioned in the groupId tag. It can have lifecycle states as defined by the operator.
Possible values are Active, Inactive, and Deactive.
Specifies the lifecycle state for subscription.

Lifecycle state of all subscriptions associated with device. It can have lifecycle states as defined by the operator. This tag is repeated for all subscription associated with device.
Possible values are Active, Inactive, and Deactive.

Contains a list of all policy counters associated with device directly or indirectly (whether applicable or not applicable). This is a customer-specific tag. This tag further contains the policyCounterID and policyCounterStat. These tags also contain the virtual policy counter/Bucket name, only if VPC feature is enabled (the VPC feature can be enabled/disables using the application preference Virtual Policy Counter Support).
Specifies the policy counter object. This is a customer-specific tag.
Specifies the policy counter ID. This is a customer-specific tag.
Specifies the policy counter status. This is a customer-specific tag.
Specifies the details for one MSCC.

Whenever a session/event request has occurred, it is either successful or unsuccessful depending upon the logic processing in NCC. This tag contains the numeric number created by NCC explaining the cause of session/event closure.
Specifies the units that the Diameter Credit-Control server can provide to the end user until the service must be released or the new Credit-Control-Request must be sent.
Signifies the type of usage reserved by NCC and same is communicated in Credit-Control-Answer to diameter client. Possible values are TVOL, IVOL, OVOL, TIME, MONEY, SERVICE_SPECIFIC.
This tag takes the value from the CCAu/CCAt AVP.
Specifies the identifier of a Rating-Group AVP present under a given MSCC inside a Credit-Control-Request messages. All the services subject to the same rating type are part of the same rating group.
Specifies the identifier of a Service identifier AVP present under a given MSCC in a Credit-Control-Request messages. Only first value from set of service ID is written.
Value of this AVP is taken from CC-Total-Octets AVP.
Value of this AVP is taken from CC-Output-Octets AVP.
Value of this AVP is taken from CC-Input-Octets AVP.
Value of this AVP is taken from CC-Service-Specific-Units AVP.

Only applicable when tariff-time change (TTC) is enabled at MSCC level.
In case of TTC, two CDRs are generated, that is, one for before and one for after. The changeCDRReason tag is added for split CDR and it is available only for "before CDR" with value BCR.
This tag is generated for MSCC CDRs during commit of the resources. The TTC sent during the previous CCA is added to this tag for before TTC CDRs.

This tag is generated for MSCC CDRs during commit of the resources. It provides information about the cause of the TTC. Valid values are: ACCOUNT, SUBSCRIPTION, GLOBAL_TTC, BUNDLE_TTC, POLICY_COUNTER.
Its value is taken from the ServiceConditionChange tag. Mapping of value of ServiceConditionChange is done with the value of Change-Condition AVP under PS-Information.

Specifies the type of Session/Event executed under a given Service Context and for which a CDR has been generated.
Possible values of this tag are PS, SMS, MMS, IMS, and OTHERS, which are derived based on the below service context.
32251@3gpp.org = PS
32274@3gpp.org = SMS
32270@3gpp.org = MMS
32260@3gpp.org = IMS
Specifies the name of the usage control Bundle. This tag appears only if UC is used in Bundle.
This tag is available only if UC limit is reached and threshold rejects the call.
This tag takes the value from the Reporting-Reason AVP available either in the Multiple-Services-Credit-Control AVP or the Used-Service-Units AVP.

Signifies the type of Sub-Session/Event record occurred. It is a sub-set of RecordEventType. For SMS/MMS, it signifies whether the triggering event is mobile originated or mobile terminated. For IMS, it signifies whether the triggering event is mobile originated or mobile terminated or mobile forwarded. For PS, there is distinct value for this tag, it takes the same value as RecordEventType.
The value of this tag is filled from the Call-Sub-Type attribute as configured in Credit Request Profile entity in NCC.

Request sequence number corresponding to each MSCC.
When the localSequenceNumber reaches its maximum value, that is, 4294967295, then for the next record the value is rolled back to 1. This is applicable for both CDRGeneratedPerMSCC and CDRGeneratedPerRequest.
The value of this tag is filled with the time reported in IMS-Information.Time-Stamps.SIP-Request-Timestamp AVP if present or Event-Timestamp if present, else platform time is used when RG is opened.
The value of this tag is filled with the time reported in IMS-Information.Time-Stamps.SIP-Request-Timestamp AVP if present or Event-Timestamp if present, else platform time is used when RG is closed.
Difference between LastDataUsage and FirstDataStart in seconds.
Written only in case of Dynamic call, if configured in slicing profile.
This tag contains a list of counter IDs (only applicable counters). This tag is flag based.
This tag contains details of a counter. This tag is flag based.
This tag indicates the counter ID.
Specifies the Unit of counter, like Byte, KB, MB, minutes, etc.

Specifies value of Counter before request has been analyzed for charging and as per counter definition and counter type. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are Seconds for time and Bytes for volume.

Specifies the value of Counter after request has been analyzed and as per configurable counter definition. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time and bytes for Volume.

It is filled from MSCC level, and if not available then it is filled from PS-Information.
This tag contains quality of service (QOS) information. This tag is flag based.
Contains child tags with QOS information. This tag is flag based.

Written from QoS-Class-Identifier AVP of QoS-Information AVP. The QoS class identifier identifies a set of IP-CAN specific QoS parameters that define QoS, excluding the applicable bitrates and ARP. It is applicable both for uplink and downlink direction. This tag is flag based.
Written from Max-Requested-Bandwidth-UL AVP of QoS-Information AVP. Defines the maximum bit rate allowed for the uplink direction.
Written from Max-Requested-Bandwidth-DL AVP of QoS-Information AVP. Defines the maximum bit rate allowed for the downlink direction.
Written from Guaranteed-Bitrate-UL AVP of QoS-Information AVP. Defines the guaranteed bit rate allowed for the uplink direction.
Written from Guaranteed-Bitrate-DL AVP of QoS-Information AVP. Defines the guaranteed bit rate allowed for the downlink direction.

Written from Priority-Level AVP of Allocation-Retention-Priority AVP of QoS-Information AVP. It is used to indicate the priority of allocation and retention, the pre-emption capability and pre-emption vulnerability for the SDF.

Written from APN-Aggregated-Max-Bitrate-UL AVP of QoS-Information AVP and it indicates the maximum aggregate bit rate in bits per seconds for the uplink direction across all non-GBR bearers related with the same APN. When provided in a CC-Request, it indicates the subscribed maximum bandwidth. When provided in a CC-Answer, it indicates the maximum bandwidth authorized by PCRF.

Written form APN-Aggregated-Max-Bitrate-DL AVP of QoS-Information AVP, and it indicates the maximum aggregate bit rate in bits per seconds for the downlink direction across all non-GBR bearers related with the same APN. When provided in a CC-Request, it indicates the subscribed maximum bitrate. When provided in a CC-Answer, it indicates the maximum bandwidth authorized by PCRF.
Contains child tags with Device information.
Contains child tags with Subscription information.
Specifies the internal InstanceID of Bundle purchased by the subscriber. Subscription is an instance of the bundle and when it is associated to a device an instance is created.
Specifies the Entity lifecycle state before the call. Different possible states of Subscription are Active, Inactive, Deactive or as configured by the operator.
This tag specifies the Bundle name purchased by Subscriber

This attribute indicate the activation type of the bundle referred to by subscription. It can be either of following:
NORMAL
ON_SESSION
Specifies the Name of Account used to purchase subscription
Contains child tags for Charging Service information.
Specifies the name of Charging Service associated to the bundle purchased by the customer.
Specifies the type of Charging Service purchased by the customer. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time which are system defined.

Specifies the priority of Charging Service as defined during the bundle purchase. It is the order in which Charging Service is selected by subscription selection logic and hence the resources of that charging services are used accordingly.

Specifies the category of Charging Service which is used as a tag to select the charging service.
Charging Service should either belong to default category (pre-provisioned) or some other operator defined category.
This tag contains child tags with Bucket information.
Specifies the name of Bucket from which charging has happened. It is the bucket defined in the tariff as a resource output and purchased by bundle.
Specifies the Unit Type of Bucket (Bytes, KB, MB, Minutes, etc.). It is defined as per customer and Type conversion defined by the operator.
Specifies the Type of Bucket. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time which are system defined.
Specifies the current value of Bucket before request received from the network to charge the requested units. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
Specifies the value of Bucket after used units are committed corresponding to used units communicated by network. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
Flag to specify if it is a carryover bucket or not.
Specifies the units that are committed in bucket for a given request. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
Specifies the units reserved from Bucket for a given request. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
This Tariff specifies the tariff corresponding to which the charging has been done for a given request.
Specifies the rate for the bucket whose type is monetary. In case of non-monetary Bucket, it is not present.

This tag is only available when CarryOverBucket=true and contains the value which is forwarded from Main Bucket remaining balance to Carry over Bucket. This tag is available in EDR at the time of reset/renewal of subscription the bucket belongs to.

Specifies the units committed to Bucket units which were there before Reset/Renewal of subscription. It is done because reservation was done from the same. This tag is filled for such scenarios where units were granted in last CCA before Reset/Renewal time and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal time.

Specifies the previous unused value of the bucket. This tag is generated if BCR occurrs between reservation and commit.
For example, if 50 bytes are reserved from a bucket and BCR occurrs, CCR-U reported 50 bytes usage in USU type Before. So the pervious unused value of bucket is 1000 – 50 = 950.
This tag contains child tags with noCharge information.
Specifies the amount reserved in case of no charge (i.e., free call).
Specifies the units allocated in case of no charge.
Specifies the tariff corresponding to no charge.
This tag contains child tags for account information.
Specifies the Id of Account which is the account name configured by the operator in the Account entity.
Specifies the Type of Account which is the type as configured by the operator in the Account entity. PrePaid or PostPaid
Specifies the lifecycle state of the Account. Different possible states of Account are Active, Inactive, Deactive or as configured by operator.
Specifies the owner of Account as configured in Account entity.
Specifies the balance of the account before the request received by the network.
Specifies the balance of Account after the used units are committed corresponding to used units communicated by network.
Specifies the balance of the account which is committed for a given request.
Specifies the amount Reserved from Account for a given request.

Specifies the units committed to Account balance units, which were there before Reset of Account. It is done because reservation was done from the same. This tag is filled for scenarios where units were granted in last CCA before Reset time, and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal time.

Specifies the value of previous balance of the account. This tag is generated if BCR occurrs between reservation and commit from the account. This is useful if lifecycle has Reset Account action (which resets the account balance).
Specifies the Overage limit as defined in Account entity.
Specifies the rate for the monetary balance which is account balance.
Specifies the identifier for the taxation profile.

Specifies the tax amount charged on committed value to the account.
This tag is also applicable for bucket money type.
Specifies the total tax amount charged to the account. This tag is also applicable for bucket money type.
Specifies the tariff corresponding to no charge.
This tag contains child tags with Counter information.
Specifies the name of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Specifies the key of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Last saved signal state of counter if counter is policy counter.

Last saved signal name of counter if counter is policy counter.This tag appears in the CDR only if the application preference Virtual Policy Counter Support is enabled (that is, the value is set to BUCKET_COUNTER).
This tag specifies the Type of Counter selected by the tariff. Possible values are DEVICE, GROUP, DEVICE_GROUP.
Specifies the unit of Counter (Bytes, KB, MB, Minutes, etc.). It is defined as per customer and type conversion.
Specifies the unit type of Counter. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time, which are system defined.

Specifies value of Counter before request has been analyzed for charging and as per counter definition and counter type. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the value of Counter after request has been analyzed and as per configurable counter definition. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the committed units which were eligible to get updated to the before reset/renewal version of a given counter. These are the units which were granted in last CCA before Reset/Renewal time and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal time.
Specifies the end date of Subscription.
Specifies the start date of Subscription.
Contains child tags with Counter information.
Specifies the name of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Specifies the key of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Last saved counter state if counter is policy counter.

Last saved signal name of counter if counter is policy counter.This tag appears in the CDR only if the application preference Virtual Policy Counter Support is enabled (that is, the value is set to BUCKET_COUNTER).
Specifies the Type of Counter selected by the tariff. Possible values are DEVICE, GROUP, DEVICE_GROUP.
Specifies the unit of Counter (Bytes, KB, MB, Minutes, etc.). It is defined as per customer and type conversion.
Specifies the unit type of Counter. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time which are system defined.

Specifies value of Counter before the request has been analyzed for charging and as per counter definition and counter type. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the value of Counter after Request has been analyzed and as per configurable counter definition. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the committed units which were eligible to get updated to the before reset/renewal version of a given counter. These are the units which were granted in last CCA before Reset/Renewal time and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal time.
Contains child tags with Group information.
Specifies the Id of the Group to which the device belongs to in the hierarchy. It is taken from the GroupID field as defined in Group entity.
Specifies the Owner of Group to which the device belongs in the hierarchy. It is taken from the Owner field as defined in Group entity.
Contains child tags with Subscription information.
Specifies the internal InstanceID of Bundle purchased by the subscriber. Subscription is an instance of the bundle and when it is associated to device an instance is created.
Specifies the Entity lifecycle state before the call. Different possible states of Subscription are Active, Inactive, Deactive or as configured by the operator.
This tag specifies the Bundle name purchased by Subscriber.

This attribute indicate the activation type of the bundle referred to by subscription. It can be either of following:
NORMAL
ON_SESSION
Specifies the Name of Account used to purchase subscription
Contains child tags with Charging Service information.
Specifies the name of Charging Service associated to the bundle purchased by the customer.
Specifies the type of Charging Service purchased by the customer. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time which are system defined.

Specifies the priority of Charging Service as defined during the bundle purchase. It is the order in which Charging Service is selected by subscription selection logic and hence the resources of that charging services are used accordingly.

Specifies the category of Charging Service which is used as a tag to select the charging service.
Charging Service should either belong to default category (pre-provisioned) or some other operator defined category.
Contains child tags with Bucket information.
Specifies the name of Bucket from which charging has happened. It specifies the bucket defined in the tariff as a resource output and purchased by bundle.

Specifies the Unit Type of Bucket (Bytes, KB, MB, Minutes, etc.). It is defined as per customer and Type conversion.
This is defined by the operator.
Specifies the Type of Bucket. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time which are system defined.
Specifies the current value of Bucket before request received from the network to charge the requested units. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
Specifies the value of Bucket after used units are committed corresponding to used units communicated by network. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
Flag to specify if it is a carryover bucket or not
Specifies the units that are committed in bucket for a given request. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
Specifies the units reserved from Bucket for a given request. Bucket values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.
This Tariff specifies the tariff corresponding to which the charging has been done for a given request.

Specifies the split for the volume/time/units/money charged between different charging resources. Only one tag from totalVolumeCharged, totalTimeCharged, totalUnitsCharged, and totalMoneyCharged is generated in a CDR.
When network sends bytes in the call, then totalVolumeCharged is generated in the CDR.
When network sends CC-Time, then totalTimeCharged is generated in the CDR.
When network sends CC-Service-Specific-Units, then totalUnitsCharged is generated in the CDR.
When network sends CC-Money, then totalMoneyCharged is generated in the CDR.
Specifies the rate for the bucket whose type is monetary. In case of Non-Monetary Bucket, this tag is not present.

This tag is only available when CarryOverBucket=true and contains the value which is forwarded from main Bucket remaining balance to carryover Bucket. This tag is available in EDR at the time of reset/renewal of subscription.

Specifies the units committed to Bucket units which were there before Reset/Renewal of subscription. It is done because reservation was done from the same. This tag is filled for such scenarios where units were granted in last CCA before Reset/Renewal time and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal.
Contains child tags with noCharge information.
Specifies the amount Reserved in case of no charge.
This tag specifies the units Allocated in case of no charge.
Specifies the tariff corresponding to no charge.
Contains child tags with account information.
Specifies the ID of Account, which is the account name configured by the operator in the Account entity.
Specifies the type of Account (PrePaid or PostPaid), which is the type as configured by the operator in the Account entity.
Specifies the lifecycle state of Account. Different possible states of Account are Active, Inactive, Deactive or as configured by operator.
Specifies the owner of Account as configured in Account entity.
Specifies the balance of the Account before the request is received by the network.
Specifies the balance of Account after the used units are committed corresponding to used units communicated by network.
Specifies the balance of the account which is committed for a given request.
Specifies the amount Reserved from Account for a given request.

Specifies the units committed to Account balance units, which were there before Reset of Account. It is done because reservation was done from the same. This tag is filled for scenarios where units were granted in last CCA before Reset time, and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal time.
Specifies the Overage limit as defined in Account entity.
Specifies the rate for the monetary balance, which is account balance.
Specifies the tariff corresponding to no charge.
Contains child tags with Counter information.
Specifies the name of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Specifies the key of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Last saved signal state of counter if counter is policy counter.

Last saved signal name of counter if counter is policy counter.This tag appears in the CDR only if the application preference Virtual Policy Counter Support is enabled (that is, the value is set to BUCKET_COUNTER).
Specifies the type of Counter selected by the tariff. Possible values are DEVICE, GROUP, and DEVICE_GROUP.
Specifies the unit of Counter (Bytes, KB, MB, Minutes, etc.). It is defined per customer and with type conversion.
Specifies the unit type of Counter. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time which are system defined.

Specifies value of Counter before the request has been analyzed for charging and as per counter definition and counter type. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the value of Counter after Request has been analyzed and as per configurable counter definition. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the committed units which were eligible to get updated to the before reset/renewal version of a given counter. These are the units which were granted in last CCA before Reset/Renewal time and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal time.
Specifies the end date of Subscription.
Specifies the start date of Subscription.
Contains child tags with Counter information.
Specifies the name of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Specifies the key of Counter selected by the tariff based upon the matched condition.
Specifies the type of Counter selected by the tariff. Possible values are DEVICE, GROUP, and DEVICE_GROUP.
Last saved counter state if counter is policy counter.

Last saved signal name of counter if counter is policy counter.This tag appears in the CDR only if the application preference Virtual Policy Counter Support is enabled (that is, the value is set to BUCKET_COUNTER).
Specifies the unit of Counter (Bytes, KB, MB, Minutes, etc.). It is defined as per customer and type conversion.
Specifies the unit type of Counter. It can be Unit/Volume/Money/Time which are system defined.

Specifies value of Counter before the request has been analyzed for charging and as per counter definition and counter type. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the value of Counter after Request has been analyzed and as per configurable counter definition. For update of Money type counter, DB precision is followed. Counter values are shown in base units which are seconds for Time, bytes for Volume.

Specifies the committed units which were eligible to get updated to the before reset/renewal version of a given counter. These are the units which were granted in last CCA before Reset/Renewal time and CCR-U is reported after Reset/Renewal time.
Contains the child tags with StepUp information.
Specifies the last step up date and time.
Contains information about the step from where current reservation is done in the charging request. This tag is generated only when the flag Step-up On Commit is set to true.
Specifies the top-up amount during stepUp. For multiple step-up in a call, this tag contains the the cumulative value of all step-ups done.
Specifies the account balance before stepUp.
Specifies the account balance after stepUp.

Specifies the fee for the stepUp. This amount is the difference between account balance before and account balance after. For multiple step-up in a call, this tag contains the the cumulative value of all step-ups done.

Specifies whether the step-up was successful. Valid values are as follows:
SUCCES: The step-up was successful
FAILURE: The step-up failed
PARTIAL_SUCCESS: Some step-ups are successful and some failed

Specifies the reason if the step-up failed.
Valid value: 0 (indicates NOT_ENOUGH_CREDIT)

table.title: Applicability of stepUp child tags for various scenarios

row.entry: Fee is not configured, StepUp is successful (backward compatible)
Fee is not configured, StepUp failed
Fee is configured, fee deduction fail due to insufficient funds in account
Fee configured, multiple (say two), StepUp successful in a slice
Fee is configured (say two), stepUp tried. First stepUp is successful, second fails in a slice
Charging from Step Bucket (Step up not performed)
